intro: Vogelocassia cobanensis, commonly known as the Coban mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas, often at elevations above 2,000 meters. Vogelocassia cobanensis is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
